Barriers: In appropriate use of emergency room
CM Intervention: Educate patient the difference between ER vs. Urgent Care, and send a list of Urgent Care facilities in the area.
Patient Intervention: Patient will verbalize understanding of use of ER vs. Urgent Care and read list of Urgent Care facilities in area.

CM Intervention: CM to look for gaps in care, such as, patient needing oxygen, home health, pain management, etc.
Patient Intervention: Patient must follow up with CM/PCP to mitigate gaps in care.

CM Intervention: CM to follow up on doctor and alert patient for apt reminder.
Patient Intervention: Patient will go to scheduled doctor's appointment.

CM Intervention: Create task for CM for benefit check and facilitate dental appointment. Also, will prompt CM to complete oral assessment (OHRA).
Patient Intervention: Patient must follow up on benefit check, and complete oral assessment (OHRA) with CM.

CM Intervention: Create task for CM for benefit check and facilitate dental appointment. Also, will prompt CM to complete oral assessment (OHRA).
Patient Intervention: Patient must follow up on benefit check, and complete oral assessment (OHRA) with CM.
Patient will complete cardiovascular assessment with CM.
Patient will complete pulmonary assessment with CM.

CM Intervention: CM will coordinate with PCP and generate a referral for an outpatient physical and occupational therapy.
Patient Intervention: Patient will participate in physical and occupational therapy program.

CM Intervention: CM will coordinate with PCP and generate a referral for a outpatient physical and occupational therapy.
Patient Intervention: Patient will participate in physical and occupational therapy program.

CM Intervention: CM will coordinate with PCP and generate a referral for a home visiting social worker/mental health provider.
Patient Intervention: Patient will participate with social worker or assist an outpatient mental health treatment.

CM Intervention: CM will check patient's transportation benefits and coordinate available community services which the patient can participate in.
Patient Intervention: Patient will use transportation and participate in community programs such as CBAS.
